back_cards.definition_en: To change from one thing to another.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s switch seats so you can see better.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for turning something on or off.
back_cards.example_en: Flip the switch to turn on the light.
She switched her phone to a new model.
The team made a switch in strategy.
The switch for the fan is broken.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Iraq or its people.
back_cards.example_en: Iraqi culture is rich with traditions.
The Iraqi shared stories of his homeland.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to Iraq’s history or government.
back_cards.example_en: Iraqi art was displayed at the museum.
I tried an Iraqi dish at the festival.

back_cards.definition_en: Of or pertaining to Iraq’s society.
back_cards.example_en: Iraqi music filled the event with energy.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong, hard metal used in tools.
back_cards.example_en: The gate is made of solid iron.
I need to iron my shirt for tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To smooth wrinkles with an iron.
back_cards.example_en: She ironed the dress before the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of strength or durability.
back_cards.example_en: He has an iron will to succeed.

back_cards.definition_en: A material in construction or manufacturing.
back_cards.example_en: The bridge’s iron beams are sturdy.

back_cards.definition_en: To notice or become aware of something.
back_cards.example_en: I could perceive his nervousness in his voice.

back_cards.definition_en: To see or sense through observation.
back_cards.example_en: She perceived a change in the weather.
He perceives the issue differently than I do.
The dog perceived danger and barked.

back_cards.definition_en: To view or regard in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: They perceive her as a strong leader.
Trust is fundamental to any relationship.

back_cards.definition_en: Serving as the foundation or core.
back_cards.example_en: The fundamental rules are easy to learn.
Her fundamental goal is to help others.

back_cards.definition_en: Underlying or central to a system.
back_cards.example_en: Freedom is a fundamental principle here.
Math is fundamental to engineering.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of words expressing an idea.
back_cards.example_en: The phrase ‘time flies’ is so true.
She used a catchy phrase in her speech.
He phrased his apology very carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: A small part of a sentence.
back_cards.example_en: The phrase was highlighted in the text.
I love the phrase ‘live and learn.’
His assumption about the meeting was wrong.
She made an assumption about his intentions.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of accepting something as true.
back_cards.example_en: That assumption led to a big mistake.
Our plan is based on certain assumptions.
Don’t make assumptions without checking facts.

back_cards.definition_en: Fine grains of rock on beaches or deserts.
back_cards.example_en: The sand on this beach is so soft.

back_cards.definition_en: To smooth a surface with sandpaper.
back_cards.example_en: He sanded the table to refinish it.
They mixed sand with cement for the foundation.
The kids played in the sand all day.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of time or vastness.
back_cards.example_en: The sand in the hourglass ran out.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who creates or plans designs.
back_cards.example_en: The designer made a stunning dress.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who creates visual or functional items.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a designer of modern furniture.
The graphic designer updated the logo.

back_cards.definition_en: A creator of fashion or products.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a famous designer in New York.

back_cards.definition_en: One who shapes or styles something.
back_cards.example_en: The designer crafted a unique website.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of making plans or arrangements.
back_cards.example_en: Wedding planning takes a lot of time.
Her careful planning made the event perfect.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of preparing for the future.
back_cards.example_en: City planning improves urban living.
The team is planning a new project.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of designing or outlining.
back_cards.example_en: Financial planning helps secure your future.

back_cards.definition_en: At the front or most important.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a leading expert in biology.
He’s leading the team to victory.
It’s the leading brand of coffee.
She’s leading the meeting today.
The leading runner crossed the finish line.

back_cards.definition_en: A way or manner of doing something.
back_cards.example_en: Switch the camera to video mode.
My phone is in airplane mode.

back_cards.definition_en: A style or type of something.
back_cards.example_en: This is the latest mode in fashion.
Her mode of teaching is engaging.

back_cards.definition_en: A state or condition of operation.
back_cards.example_en: The game has a multiplayer mode.

back_cards.definition_en: Over a large area or range.
back_cards.example_en: Her music is widely popular.

back_cards.definition_en: To a great extent or degree.
back_cards.example_en: The book is widely read in schools.
This issue is widely debated.
The product is widely available online.
His ideas are widely accepted.
The party was a special occasion.

back_cards.definition_en: A reason or cause for something.
back_cards.example_en: There’s no occasion to worry now.
I met her on one occasion last year.
The wedding was a joyous occasion.
On rare occasions, we go hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: To present or create, like a problem.
back_cards.example_en: This issue poses a challenge for us.

back_cards.definition_en: To stand or sit for a photo.
back_cards.example_en: She posed for the family picture.

back_cards.definition_en: To act or pretend to be something.
back_cards.example_en: He posed as a doctor to gain trust.

back_cards.definition_en: A position or stance for effect.
back_cards.example_en: Her pose was perfect for the shoot.

back_cards.definition_en: To raise or introduce a question.
back_cards.example_en: He posed a question to the group.
The trip takes approximately two hours.
There were approximately 50 people there.
The cost is approximately $100.
It’s approximately 10 miles away.
The event starts approximately at noon.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop working, usually due to age.
back_cards.example_en: She plans to retire at 65.

back_cards.definition_en: To withdraw or leave a situation.
back_cards.example_en: He retired from the game early.

back_cards.definition_en: To go to bed or rest.
back_cards.example_en: I’m exhausted and ready to retire.

back_cards.definition_en: To take something out of use.
back_cards.example_en: They retired the old uniforms.

back_cards.definition_en: To step back from active duty.
back_cards.example_en: The general retired after 30 years.
We looked elsewhere for better prices.
The team is playing elsewhere tonight.
She found the book elsewhere online.
If it’s not here, try elsewhere.
The festival is happening elsewhere this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A celebration with events or activities.
back_cards.example_en: The music festival was a huge hit.
The town hosts a harvest festival.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of performances or shows.
back_cards.example_en: The film festival showcased new talent.
The festival had food and games.
The spring festival drew big crowds.

back_cards.definition_en: A head covering, like a hat.
back_cards.example_en: He wore a baseball cap to the game.
There’s a cap on how much we can spend.

back_cards.definition_en: To put a lid or cover on.
back_cards.example_en: Cap the bottle tightly after use.
The mountain’s cap was snowy.
They capped ticket sales at 500.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something safe or protected.
back_cards.example_en: We need to secure the house before leaving.
The documents are in a secure location.
She secured a deal with the client.
The ladder is secure and won’t slip.
He secured the gate with a padlock.
Attach the file to your email.

back_cards.definition_en: To join or link with something.
back_cards.example_en: She attached a note to the gift.

back_cards.definition_en: To add or include as part.
back_cards.example_en: They attached a new clause to the contract.

back_cards.definition_en: To bind or tie to something.
back_cards.example_en: He attached the trailer to the truck.
She’s very attached to her old car.

back_cards.definition_en: A system or process for doing something.
back_cards.example_en: The mechanism for voting is simple.
The clock’s mechanism stopped working.
The mechanism of the lock is complex.
We need a mechanism to resolve disputes.
The car’s braking mechanism was faulty.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or purpose to do something.
back_cards.example_en: Her intention is to start a business.

back_cards.definition_en: The aim or goal behind an action.
back_cards.example_en: His intention was to help, not harm.
She had no intention of staying late.

back_cards.definition_en: The motive or reason for something.
back_cards.example_en: The gift was given with good intentions.

back_cards.definition_en: A desire to achieve an outcome.
back_cards.example_en: My intention is to finish this today.
We planned for every possible scenario.
The worst-case scenario is a delay.

back_cards.definition_en: A description of what might happen.
back_cards.example_en: She outlined a scenario for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting or context for events.
back_cards.example_en: This scenario feels like a movie.
The best scenario is we finish early.
She yelled to get the team’s attention.
His yell echoed across the field.

back_cards.definition_en: To call out in a loud voice.
back_cards.example_en: Don’t yell; I’m right here!

back_cards.definition_en: To express anger or excitement loudly.
back_cards.example_en: He yelled when his team scored.
Her yell startled everyone in the room.
The view from the mountain was incredible.
She did an incredible job on the project.
His strength is absolutely incredible.
The concert was an incredible experience.
The story sounds incredible but true.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Spain or its culture.
back_cards.example_en: Spanish cuisine includes paella and tapas.
She’s learning Spanish for her trip.
The Spanish artist painted vibrant murals.
Spanish music filled the festival.
The Spanish architecture was stunning.
She strongly believes in equal rights.

back_cards.definition_en: In a firm or powerful way.
back_cards.example_en: He strongly opposed the new rule.
I strongly recommend this restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: In a robust or vigorous manner.
back_cards.example_en: The team strongly defended their title.

back_cards.definition_en: With a high degree of emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: She’s strongly committed to the cause.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to race or ethnic groups.
back_cards.example_en: The debate focused on racial equality.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to racial identity or issues.
back_cards.example_en: Racial tensions sparked the protest.
The policy aims to end racial discrimination.
Racial diversity enriches the community.
The report addressed racial disparities.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of moving people or goods.
back_cards.example_en: Public transportation is reliable here.
The city invested in better transportation.
Buses are a common form of transportation.
Transportation of goods takes time.
Her transportation to work is a bike.

back_cards.definition_en: A container for cooking or holding.
back_cards.example_en: She cooked soup in a big pot.
He got caught with a bag of pot.

back_cards.definition_en: A vessel for plants or flowers.
back_cards.example_en: The pot on the porch holds roses.

back_cards.definition_en: The total money in a game.
back_cards.example_en: He won the poker pot with a flush.
The recipe needs a heavy pot.
Her boyfriend took her to dinner.
My boyfriend loves watching movies.

back_cards.definition_en: A partner in a romantic relationship.
back_cards.example_en: Her boyfriend sent her flowers.
He’s been her boyfriend since high school.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a male companion.
back_cards.example_en: I’m meeting my boyfriend later.
We gave the plan serious consideration.
Cost is a major consideration for us.
She showed consideration by arriving early.
Safety was a key consideration.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of thinking over something.
back_cards.example_en: After consideration, we chose the cheaper option.
I had a meeting prior to lunch.
Her family takes prior over work.
Prior experience is required for the job.
We discussed it prior to the event.
Prior commitments kept her from joining.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of leaving a job permanently.
back_cards.example_en: He’s looking forward to his retirement.
She travels a lot in retirement.
Retirement gave him time for hobbies.
They moved to a retirement community.

back_cards.definition_en: A phase of life after career.
back_cards.example_en: Retirement planning is important early on.
I rarely eat out during the week.
She rarely visits her hometown anymore.
He rarely talks about his past.
It rarely snows in this city.
They rarely agree on anything.

back_cards.definition_en: Shared or done by two or more.
back_cards.example_en: We made a joint decision to move.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where two parts connect.
back_cards.example_en: The joint in the pipe is leaking.

back_cards.definition_en: Slang for a cigarette with marijuana.
back_cards.example_en: He rolled a joint at the party.
Her knee joint was sore after running.
The project was a joint effort.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep something safe or intact.
back_cards.example_en: We need to preserve this historic building.

back_cards.definition_en: To maintain or protect from harm.
back_cards.example_en: She works to preserve endangered species.

back_cards.definition_en: To prepare food for long-term storage.
back_cards.example_en: They preserve fruit by canning it.
The law preserves our rights.

back_cards.definition_en: To save or reserve for future use.
back_cards.example_en: He preserved his energy for the race.

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size or amount.
back_cards.example_en: The elephant is an enormous animal.
The project required an enormous effort.
The crowd was enormous at the concert.
The cost of repairs was enormous.
Her talent is absolutely enormous.

back_cards.definition_en: A small roll of tobacco for smoking.
back_cards.example_en: He lit a cigarette outside the bar.
She quit smoking cigarettes last year.
The pack of cigarettes was expensive.
He offered me a cigarette, but I declined.
Cigarettes are harmful to your health.

back_cards.definition_en: A building where goods are made.
back_cards.example_en: The factory produces cars daily.
She works at a clothing factory.
The factory employs hundreds of workers.
The factory shut down for repairs.
This factory makes eco-friendly toys.
This antique vase is very valuable.
Her advice was valuable to the team.
These memories are valuable to me.
Time is a valuable resource.
The painting is a valuable piece of art.

back_cards.definition_en: A small device to hold things together.
back_cards.example_en: She used a clip to secure the papers.
He clipped the bushes in the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: A short video or film segment.
back_cards.example_en: I saw a clip of the movie online.
Clip the badge to your shirt.
She gave her hair a quick clip.
The electric car is eco-friendly.
The electric bill was high this month.
The crowd’s energy was electric.
An electric heater warmed the room.
Her performance was absolutely electric.

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size or scale.
back_cards.example_en: The giant tree towered over the park.
The story told of a friendly giant.
They built a giant statue downtown.
The company is a giant in tech.
That’s a giant cupcake for the party!

back_cards.definition_en: A person owned or controlled by another.
back_cards.example_en: The history book described the lives of slaves.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone forced to work without freedom.
back_cards.example_en: Slaves worked on the plantation long ago.

back_cards.definition_en: To work extremely hard, often unwillingly.
back_cards.example_en: She slaved over the project all night.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in servitude or bondage.
back_cards.example_en: The museum had artifacts from former slaves.
He felt like a slave to his job.

back_cards.definition_en: To present or hand in something.
back_cards.example_en: Please submit your application by Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: To yield or give in to authority.
back_cards.example_en: He refused to submit to the rules.

back_cards.definition_en: To offer for review or consideration.
back_cards.example_en: She submitted her article to the magazine.
They submitted to the new leadership.
I submitted my taxes online.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that produces results.
back_cards.example_en: She communicated her ideas effectively.
The team worked effectively together.

back_cards.definition_en: In a practical or impactful way.
back_cards.example_en: He solved the problem effectively.
The campaign was run effectively.

back_cards.definition_en: In a manner that achieves goals.
back_cards.example_en: She manages her time effectively.

back_cards.definition_en: To watch or keep track of something.
back_cards.example_en: We monitor the weather for updates.
The computer monitor is brand new.
She monitors her students’ work closely.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for tracking or measuring.
back_cards.example_en: The heart monitor beeped steadily.
He monitors the team’s daily tasks.

back_cards.definition_en: To solve or settle a problem.
back_cards.example_en: They resolved the issue quickly.
She resolved to exercise every day.

back_cards.definition_en: To find a solution or answer.
back_cards.example_en: We need to resolve this conflict soon.
The committee resolved to approve the plan.
He resolved the error in the code.
The remaining food was donated.

back_cards.definition_en: What is left after others are gone.
back_cards.example_en: She ate the remaining slice of pizza.
The remaining tasks will take a week.
The remaining tickets sold out fast.
We have a few remaining seats.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of taking part or joining.
back_cards.example_en: Her participation in the club is active.

back_cards.definition_en: Involvement in an activity or event.
back_cards.example_en: Participation in the survey is voluntary.
Team participation improved our results.
Participation in sports builds character.

back_cards.definition_en: Taking part in a group effort.
back_cards.example_en: His participation made the event fun.

back_cards.definition_en: A small river or flow of water.
back_cards.example_en: The stream runs through the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: To transmit or watch online content.
back_cards.example_en: I stream movies on my phone.
A stream of cars passed by.
Tears streamed down her face.

back_cards.definition_en: A sequence or series of data.
back_cards.example_en: The app streams music all day.

back_cards.definition_en: To remove or free from something.
back_cards.example_en: I want to rid my house of clutter.

back_cards.definition_en: To eliminate or get rid of.
back_cards.example_en: She rid her diet of sugary snacks.
He rid the room of old furniture.

back_cards.definition_en: To be free of an unwanted thing.
back_cards.example_en: They rid the town of pests.
Let’s rid ourselves of these old habits.
The origin of the river is in the mountains.
Her family’s origin is Italian.

back_cards.definition_en: The cause or root of something.
back_cards.example_en: The origin of the problem was a mistake.
He’s proud of his African origins.
The origin of the tradition is ancient.
The teen joined the soccer team.
Teen fashion is always changing.

back_cards.definition_en: A young person in their teens.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a teen but acts so mature.
The movie is a teen favorite.
Teens love hanging out at the mall.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a congress or legislature.
back_cards.example_en: The congressional vote was unanimous.
She attended a congressional hearing.
The congressional budget was approved.
Congressional leaders met yesterday.
The issue sparked congressional debate.
She bound the books with string.
The contract binds us to finish.
He bound the wound with a bandage.
Their friendship binds them for life.
This agreement binds both parties.
She wore a warm coat in the snow.
Coat the chicken with breadcrumbs.

back_cards.definition_en: A layer of paint or material.
back_cards.example_en: The wall needs another coat of paint.

back_cards.definition_en: An animal’s fur or outer layer.
back_cards.example_en: The dog’s coat is shiny and healthy.

back_cards.definition_en: To apply a covering or finish.
back_cards.example_en: They coated the floor with wax.

back_cards.definition_en: A tall, narrow building or structure.
back_cards.example_en: The tower offers a great city view.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure taller than its surroundings.
back_cards.example_en: The radio tower broadcasts signals.

back_cards.definition_en: To rise high or stand tall.
back_cards.example_en: The skyscraper towers over the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A tall part of a building.
back_cards.example_en: The castle’s tower was ancient.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of height or strength.
back_cards.example_en: The tower stood as a landmark.

back_cards.definition_en: A permit to do something legally.
back_cards.example_en: She got her driver’s license yesterday.
The license allows fishing in the lake.
They licensed the software for use.
His medical license is valid.
He took license with the rules.

back_cards.definition_en: A social media platform for short posts.
back_cards.example_en: She shared the news on Twitter.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of posting on the platform.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll Twitter about the event later.
Twitter is buzzing with the game’s score.
He follows celebrities on Twitter.
Twitter’s logo is a blue bird.
The city imposed a new tax.

back_cards.definition_en: To place a burden or requirement.
back_cards.example_en: They imposed strict rules on us.
The judge imposed a heavy fine.
I don’t want to impose on your time.
The school imposed a dress code.
The jury found him innocent.
She has an innocent smile.
He’s innocent of all accusations.
Her innocent question surprised me.
The child is innocent in this matter.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of courses or subjects taught.
back_cards.example_en: The school updated its curriculum.

back_cards.definition_en: The content of an educational program.
back_cards.example_en: Math is part of the curriculum.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan for learning or study.
back_cards.example_en: The curriculum includes art classes.
Her curriculum is heavy this semester.

back_cards.definition_en: The subjects offered in a school.
back_cards.example_en: The curriculum prepares students for college.

back_cards.definition_en: Letters or packages sent by post.
back_cards.example_en: I got a package in the mail today.

back_cards.definition_en: To send something through the postal system.
back_cards.example_en: She mailed the letter yesterday.
Check your mail for the invite.
The mail arrives every afternoon.
He received fan mail from readers.
Her insight into the problem was helpful.
He had an insight about the project.
She has great insight into human behavior.
His insights improved our strategy.
The book offers insight into history.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who examines or researches.
back_cards.example_en: The investigator looked into the case.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who gathers facts or evidence.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an investigator for the police.
The investigator found new clues.
He’s a private investigator for hire.
The investigator interviewed the witnesses.
The flu virus spread quickly.
My laptop got a virus from a download.
The rumor spread like a virus.
The virus was studied in the lab.
Fear was a virus in the community.
The hurricane hit the coast last night.
They evacuated due to the hurricane.
The hurricane caused widespread damage.
Hurricane Maria was devastating.

back_cards.definition_en: A violent storm with heavy rain.
back_cards.example_en: The hurricane brought floods to the city.
Her prediction was surprisingly accurate.
The map is accurate to the mile.
The report needs to be accurate.
His description was accurate and detailed.
Her aim was accurate in the game.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of providing or supplying.
back_cards.example_en: The provision of food was generous.

back_cards.definition_en: A clause or condition in an agreement.
back_cards.example_en: The contract has a key provision.
They made provisions for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A rule or term in a law.
back_cards.example_en: The law’s provision protects workers.
Provisions were sent to the shelter.
We communicate daily through email.
She communicates her ideas clearly.

back_cards.definition_en: To connect or interact with others.
back_cards.example_en: He communicates well with the team.
The sign communicates the rules.

back_cards.definition_en: To talk or interact with someone.
back_cards.example_en: They communicate through video calls.

back_cards.definition_en: To differ or change in some way.
back_cards.example_en: Prices vary depending on the season.
The results vary from person to person.

back_cards.definition_en: To alter or shift over time.
back_cards.example_en: Her mood varies throughout the day.
The sizes vary from small to large.
You can vary the recipe to taste.

back_cards.definition_en: A short coat or outer garment.
back_cards.example_en: I wore a jacket because it’s chilly.
The book’s jacket has a cool design.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of clothing for warmth.
back_cards.example_en: Her leather jacket looks stylish.
The pipe’s jacket prevents heat loss.
He grabbed his jacket and ran out.
The increasing demand caused price hikes.
Her increasing confidence was noticeable.
The city faces increasing traffic issues.
Increasing costs are a concern for us.
There’s increasing interest in the event.

back_cards.definition_en: In the same way or amount.
back_cards.example_en: We split the work equally among us.

back_cards.definition_en: To the same degree or extent.
back_cards.example_en: Both teams are equally skilled.
Everyone was treated equally in class.

back_cards.definition_en: In a balanced or even manner.
back_cards.example_en: The funds were distributed equally.
All opinions are equally valid here.
The decision has serious implications.
Her silence had an implication of guilt.
The implication of the study is clear.
His words carried a deeper implication.
The implication in the scandal was avoided.

back_cards.definition_en: Literature that is imagined or made up.
back_cards.example_en: She loves reading science fiction novels.
His story about aliens was pure fiction.
The book is a work of fiction.
Fiction allows writers to explore new worlds.
That rumor is complete fiction.

back_cards.definition_en: To object or oppose something publicly.
back_cards.example_en: They protested the new law downtown.
The protest drew hundreds of people.
She protested when her idea was ignored.
The workers held a protest for better pay.
He protested his innocence to the judge.
Mama made my favorite cookies today.

back_cards.definition_en: A affectionate name for a mom.
back_cards.example_en: I called mama to tell her the news.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of endearment for a mother.
back_cards.example_en: Mama always knows what to say.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a nurturing figure.
back_cards.example_en: She’s like a mama to the whole team.

back_cards.definition_en: A casual or loving word for mom.
back_cards.example_en: Mama hugged me when I got home.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest something without stating it.
back_cards.example_en: Her tone implied she was upset.
He implied we should leave early.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate or mean by suggestion.
back_cards.example_en: The sign implies no parking here.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest a connection or consequence.
back_cards.example_en: Her words implied a deeper meaning.
His smile implied he agreed.

back_cards.definition_en: One of two children born together.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a twin and looks just like her sister.
This city is a twin to mine.
The twin towers were iconic landmarks.

back_cards.definition_en: Born at the same time as another.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the older twin by five minutes.
The cars are twins in design.

back_cards.definition_en: To breathe heavily, often after effort.
back_cards.example_en: She was panting after running a mile.

back_cards.definition_en: A pair of trousers or pants.
back_cards.example_en: He wore black pants to the event.
The dog panted in the hot sun.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of clothing for the legs.
back_cards.example_en: Her new pants fit perfectly.

back_cards.definition_en: To breathe with effort or excitement.
back_cards.example_en: He panted from climbing the stairs.

back_cards.definition_en: To curve or make something not straight.
back_cards.example_en: She bent the wire into a circle.

back_cards.definition_en: A curve or turn in something.
back_cards.example_en: The road has a sharp bend ahead.

back_cards.definition_en: To lean or flex the body.
back_cards.example_en: He bent down to tie his shoe.
They bent the rules for us.
The river’s bend is a great fishing spot.
The news of her win was a shock.
His decision shocked everyone.
He got a shock from the wire.
She was in shock after the accident.
The result was a complete shock.
The criteria for the job are strict.
She met all the criteria for admission.
The criteria include experience and skills.
These criteria will guide our choice.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of principles for assessment.
back_cards.example_en: The criteria were outlined clearly.

back_cards.definition_en: A person from an Arabic-speaking country.
back_cards.example_en: The Arab shared stories of his culture.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Arab culture or people.
back_cards.example_en: Arab music filled the festival.
The museum displayed Arab artifacts.
Arab cuisine is rich and flavorful.
The Arab poet recited beautiful verses.
My shoes got dirty in the mud.
The dishes in the sink are dirty.
He played a dirty trick on his friend.
That joke was a bit dirty.
The kids came home with dirty clothes.

back_cards.definition_en: An object for children to play with.
back_cards.example_en: The toy car zoomed across the floor.

back_cards.definition_en: To play or fiddle with something.
back_cards.example_en: He toyed with his pencil during class.
The shop sells cute stuffed toys.
The dog loves his new toy.
She toyed with the idea of moving.
This could potentially be a problem.
She’s potentially our best candidate.
The idea is potentially very profitable.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that could happen.
back_cards.example_en: It’s potentially rainy this afternoon.
He’s potentially a great leader.
The assault left him with bruises.
He was arrested for assaulting a neighbor.
The army launched an assault at dawn.
Her harsh words felt like an assault.
The police investigated the assault case.
We reached the mountain’s peak at noon.
Her career is at its peak now.
Sales peaked during the holidays.
The peak of the season is summer.

back_cards.definition_en: The best or most intense moment.
back_cards.example_en: His performance hit its peak tonight.
His anger boiled over during the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: To make someone upset or mad.
back_cards.example_en: Her comment angered the whole team.
She spoke with anger in her voice.
His anger was hard to control.

back_cards.definition_en: A reaction to injustice or hurt.
back_cards.example_en: The decision sparked anger among fans.
She wore boots in the snow.
He booted the ball across the field.
The car’s wheel had a boot on it.
Wait for the computer to boot up.
They gave him the boot from the team.
The movie’s ending was so dramatic.
She’s studying dramatic arts in college.
A dramatic change in weather hit us.
His reaction was overly dramatic.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a powerful or vivid impact.
back_cards.example_en: The speech had a dramatic effect.

back_cards.definition_en: A person of the same age or status.
back_cards.example_en: She discussed the issue with her peers.
He peered through the foggy window.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone equal in rank or ability.
back_cards.example_en: His peers respect his leadership.
The team reviewed each peer’s work.
She peered at the tiny print.
This app will enhance your photos.

back_cards.definition_en: To increase the quality or value.
back_cards.example_en: Her skills enhance the team’s success.
Spices enhance the flavor of the dish.
The update enhanced the software’s speed.
Good lighting enhances the room’s vibe.

back_cards.definition_en: The study of numbers and shapes.
back_cards.example_en: Math is my favorite subject in school.
She’s really good at math.
The math for this project is complex.

back_cards.definition_en: A field involving logic and numbers.
back_cards.example_en: Math helps us understand patterns.
We have a math test tomorrow.
